title: HIV Incidence Risk Index for MSM (HIRI-MSM)
description: Identifies men who have sex with men (MSM) at high risk for HIV infection to prioritize for intensive prevention interventions including pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP).

parameters.name: num_male_partners
parameters.description: Number of male sex partners in last 6 months

parameters.name: receptive_anal_no_condom
parameters.description: Receptive anal sex without condom in last 6 months

parameters.name: num_hiv_positive_partners
parameters.description: Number of HIV-positive male sex partners in last 6 months

parameters.name: insertive_anal_hiv_positive
parameters.description: Insertive anal sex without condom with HIV-positive partner in last 6 months

parameters.name: poppers_use
parameters.description: Poppers (amyl nitrate) use in last 6 months

result.name: hiri_msm_score
result.description: HIRI-MSM risk score for HIV incidence

ranges.interpretation: Low HIV risk. Standard HIV prevention counseling recommended. Continue routine HIV testing and safer sex practices.

High HIV risk. This score has 84% sensitivity and 45% specificity for predicting incident HIV infection in the next 6 months. Strongly consider pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) and intensive HIV prevention interventions. Discuss risk reduction strategies and increase HIV testing frequency.

references: Smith DK, Pals SL, Herbst JH, Shinde S, Carey JW. Development of a clinical screening index predictive of incident HIV infection among men who have sex with men in the United States. J Acquir Immune Defic Syndr. 2012 Aug 1;60(4):421-7.

Wilton J, Noor SW, Schnubb A, Lawless J, Hart TA, Grennan T, et al. High HIV risk and syndemic burden regardless of referral source among MSM screening for a PrEP demonstration project in Toronto, Canada. BMC Public Health. 2018 Mar 2;18(1):292.

Jones J, Hoenigl M, Siegler AJ, Sullivan PS, Little S, Rosenberg E. Assessing the Performance of 3 Human Immunodeficiency Virus Incidence Risk Scores in a Cohort of Black and White Men Who Have Sex With Men in the South. Sex Transm Dis. 2017 May;44(5):297-302.
formula: Sum of points from 7 risk factors: age category + number of partners + receptive anal sex + HIV-positive partners + insertive anal sex with HIV-positive + methamphetamine use + poppers use
notes: All behaviors assessed over the last 6 months
Designed for MSM aged 18 years and older
Cutoff of ≥10 recommended for PrEP consideration
Performance may vary by population and geographic region
Should be used alongside clinical judgment and local HIV epidemiology
